#summary How to get started with Swarm

= Install tools =
  # Get and install the latest versions of:
    * The Java Development Kit (at least Java 1.6)
    * Subversion
    * Git

= Installing Scala 2.8 and Continuations Plugin =

  # Get the latest snapshot of Scala 2.8 [http://www.scala-lang.org/archives/downloads/distrib/files/nightly/distributions/scala-2.8.0.latest.tgz here]
  # Decompress it somewhere 
{{{
$ tar xzf scala-2.8.0.r17146-b20090219020925.tgz
}}}
  # Once you have a build, set the SCALA_HOME environment variable to point to your new installation (you can add this to your .bashrc file)
{{{
$ export SCALA_HOME=.../scala-2.8.0.r17146-b20090219020925
}}}
  # Add the bin/ directory in the scala folder to your path
  # Verify that Scala 2.8 works:
{{{
$ scala -version
Scala code runner version 2.8.0.r18431-b20090803020212 -- Copyright 2002-2009, LAMP/EPFL
}}}
  # Get the continuations plugin from their subversion repository:
{{{
$ svn co http://lampsvn.epfl.ch/svn-repos/scala/compiler-plugins/continuations/trunk continuations
$ cd continuations
}}}
  # Then build it.
{{{
$ ANT_OPTS=-Xmx512m ant test
}}}
  # Now set your SCALA_C_DIR environment variable to point to the continuations directory, you can add this to your .bashrc file:
{{{
$ export SCALA_C_DIR=/Users/ian/local/share/scala/plugin-build/continuations
}}}
  # Ok, now you're ready to download Swarm using git:
{{{
$ git clone git://github.com/sanity/Swarm.git
}}}
  # And build it:
{{{
$ cd Swarm
$ ./build.sh
}}}
  # If there are no errors, run a demo:
From the Swarm directory, in one console window:
{{{
$ ./run.sh Listen 9997
}}}
Then, in another console window:
{{{
$ ./run.sh ExplicitMoveTo1 9998 start
}}}
